content: The "Neutral Cost Recovery Act for Small Business" may be cited as the Short Title. It includes Increased Expensing for Small Business. The Neutral Cost Recovery Act for Small Business, also known as the Short Title, includes an amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment increases the dollar limitation for the aggregate cost that can be taken into account for any taxable year to $75,000. Additionally, there is an increase in the phaseout threshold for the reduction in limitation. The dollar limitation for the aggregate cost applicable for any taxable year is reduced by the basis of property placed in service under section 168(k). The phaseout threshold is increased from $200,000 to $325,000. The definition of section 179 property is amended to include certain computer software. The phaseout threshold for the dollar limitation on aggregate cost is increased from $200,000 to $325,000. The definition of section 179 property now includes certain computer software. The term "section 179 property" includes tangible property, computer software, and section 1245 property acquired for use in a trade or business, excluding certain types of property. The term "section 179 property" includes tangible property, computer software, and section 1245 property acquired for use in a trade or business, excluding certain types of property. Subsection (b) of section 179 of the Code is amended to include inflation adjustments for taxable years. Inflation adjustments are made to the dollar amounts in section 179 for taxable years starting after 2003.
